name: Pgrid
tagline: P-Grid, a self-organizing structured peer-to-peer system.
body:
# Middleware for Fault Tolerant PGrid Networks P-Grid is a self-organizing structured peer-to-peer system, which can accommodate arbitrary key distributions, still providing storage load-balancing and efficient search by using randomized routing. This project is an implementation of the peer-to-peer infrastructure of P-Grid. The main goal is to add a fault-tolerant protocol. The implementation is based on SOA principles. This project is part of my dissertation. ## Getting started ### Libraries in use * [Google guice 3.0](http://code.google.com/p/google-guice/) * [logback 1.0](http://logback.qos.ch/) * [slf4j 1.6.4](http://www.slf4j.org/) ### Compilation Run the following commands to produce all the needed corba interfaces and classes before compilation. 1. cd pgrid 2. idlj -fall -td src/ resources/pgrid_corba.idl Finally run the ant script. # License This software is licensed under the GPL version 3 license, quoted below.
